definition: to threaten the east and strike to the west (idiom)/to create a diversion
sound/voice/tone/noise/reputation/classifier for sounds
surname Dong
east/host (i.e. sitting on east side of guest)/landlord
to hit/to strike/to break/Taiwan pr. [ji2]
west
the West/abbr. for Spain 西班牙[Xi1 ban1 ya2]/Spanish

sentences.english: Could all that talk of the Golden Company sailing west have been a feint?
sentences.chinese: 那些关于黄金团向西起航的传言难道是声东击西？

sentences.english: The landing in Normandy is merely a diversionary maneuver.
sentences.chinese: 诺曼底登陆只是声东击西的阳动。

sentences.english: This is his versed trick, what's called "selling the drummy".
sentences.chinese: 这是他所精通的“声东击西”的伎俩。

sentences.english: Moment he diversion, while laughing off the language.
sentences.chinese: 他一会儿声东击西，一会儿笑而不语。

definition: to lure the tiger from its domain in the mountains (idiom)/to lure an enemy away from his territory
lit. to besiege 魏[Wei4] and rescue 趙|赵[Zhao4] (idiom)/fig. to relieve a besieged ally by attacking the home base of the besiegers
lit. to pull a snake from its hole/to expose a malefactor (idiom)

lit. secretly crossing the Wei River 渭河[Wei4 He2] at Chencang (idiom, refers to a stratagem used by Liu Bang 劉邦|刘邦[Liu2 Bang1] in 206 BC against Xiang Yu 項羽|项羽[Xiang4 Yu3] of Chu)/fig. to feign one thing while doing another/to cheat under cover of a diversion
to beat sb at their own game (idiom)
to catch an enemy off guard with a surprise attack (idiom, from Sunzi's "The Art of War" 孫子兵法|孙子兵法[Sun1 zi3 Bing1 fa3])
pinyin: chu1 qi2 bu4 yi4 , gong1 qi2 bu4 bei4

definition: to do sth when least expected (idiom); to catch sb off guard
to besiege and strike the relief force (idiom); strategy of surrounding a unit to entice the enemy to reinforce, then striking the new troops
to lend sb a knife to kill sb/to get sb else to do one's dirty work/to attack using the strength of another (idiom)
to defeat the enemy by capturing their chief (idiom)
see 出其不意，攻其不備|出其不意，攻其不备[chu1 qi2 bu4 yi4 , gong1 qi2 bu4 bei4]
surprise attack/raid
trick/ruse/crafty scheme
to win by a surprise move
(idiom) stay clear of the enemy's main force and strike at his weak points
stratagem/scheme
